name: Madhubani Art - Workshop by Trishna Patnaik
description:
India has a rich tradition of folk arts. The custodians of which are the many tribes that live in the interiors of various states. Madhubani or Mithila painting is a folk art form, originated from Mithila region of Bihar.
The paintings are traditionally based on mythological, folk themes and pastoral symbols. The designs announce the occasion of the celebration and solicit good fortune and divine blessings.
Participate in the Madhubani Art Workshop, get a chance to appreciate the art form and create your very own Madhubani Art masterpiece with acrylic colours on cartridge sheets.
Date: 9th October, 2025 (Thursday)
Timings:  1:30 to 3:30  pm
Age Group: Teens and Adults
Fees: 1300 INR per person including Art Material 
Venue: Atta Galatta, Bengaluru 
Takeaway: One Complete Painting (A3 size)
For registrations please contact Trishna Patnaik on 9867982075 (Whatsapp).

name: Ganga’s Curse: A re-telling of the puranic story - Storytelling by The Kutumb Foundation
description:
Ganga’s Curse is a ‘re-telling’ of the Puranic story of Ganga’s descent to Earth by children’s author and storyteller Kapil Pandey. As it unfolds, it asks multiple questions about human apathy and neglect, about the connections we refuse to make with our environment, about what our myths and legends stand for, and about our unwillingness to ask questions — of ourselves and of the world we inhabit. This tongue-in-cheek account is musical and interactive, and for adults (children below 12 not allowed).
BANGALORE:
🗓️   10th October
🕕   6:30
📍    Atta Galatta- The Bookstore, 178, 5th Main Road, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bangalore
✔️   1 Hour Storytelling Performance
✔️   English and Hindi
✔️   Ages 12 and Up
💝   Tickets at 1,200 available on Urbanaut 

The proceeds will be used to support Kutumb’s work to help disadvantaged young people empower themselves across Delhi NCR and India. Kutumb is committed to promoting the arts and the joy of learning.  For more information, please visit kutumb.in or reach out to info@kutumb.in.

name: Qu for Quiz - Quiz by Karthik Srinivasan and Ganesh Balakrishnan
description:
The Qu for Quiz is based on a grid format with the grids formed by topics on one axis and level of difficulty (and hence the points) on the other. The topics could be varied like History, Sports, Music, Literature, Movies and more. A team of two members would get to choose a topic and the level of difficulty and the question would be revealed. The rest of the teams can go for the buzzer if they know the answer. Depending on the number of teams registering, the size of the grid would be decided. 
SAMPLE Qu: 2. The name is inspired by the traditional malt whisky distillation process in which malted barley was mixed by hand with shovels. This labor-intensive process often caused a shoulder injury to workers, causing their arms to hang low. Which brand is named thus? 
Ganesh Balakrishnan is an entrepreneur, marketer and creator of terrible dad jokes. His claim to fame is attempting to sell shoes during the pandemic, culminating in a viral Shark Tank "Down But Not Out" appearance. He is a collector of useless facts since childhood, and has dabbled in trivia quiz circuits since college. ganesh.flatheads@gmail.com

Karthik Srinivasan is a pseudo-retired software leader by choice, specializing in innovative ideas to spend time that include organizing cricket leagues at the scale of IPL but for free, staying up to date on latest debates in virtual social groups helmed by family and friends and more on similar lines. emailkarth@gmail.com

name: Atta Galatta presents “AG Book Club” - Monthly Book Club with Palgun KJ
description:
What have you been reading? Come, discuss your latest read. Each member gets 5-7 minutes to talk about the book, theme, plot, with 2 minutes to answer any questions others might have. This month’s special focus will be food- come tell us what you've been reading.
October's special focus will be books on Food

name: An Evening with Aditi Krishnakumar: The Real History Behind the Murder Mystery - An interactive session with Aditi Krishnakumar
description:
From merchants to teachers, from cowherds to moneylenders, our history is the story of people whose lives wove together into the sometimes inspiring, sometimes tragic, always rich and always layered tapestry of India.  
Join Aditi Krishnakumar, author of The White Lotus, for an interactive session on murders, the social pressures inherent in daily life, and how fiction makes history real – and leave with something that you’ve written yourself.

name: The Bougainvillea Circle - Connection Circle by Radhika Ghose
description:
"Sawubona" a Zulu Greeting meaning, "We See You". At Bougainvillea Circles you are offered a space to be heard, seen, welcomed as you are. A non-judgmental, safe, trusted space where you are free to be all that you want to be. Nothing More, Nothing less. No Restrictions, no judgements, just an intimate group of people looking for a space to be real. A space where we`re all less alone for a little while. Where we are seen, how we want to be seen. Conversations, Connections, Community of Compassion. All that makes the world go round, after Love of course!
Remember - Sawubona: We See You.

name: Launch of Masala Mandi by Chef Sadaf Hussain - A Guide to the World of Indian Spice Blends by Karwaan
description:
Karwaan Heritage, in collaboration with Atta Galatta, invites you to an evocative evening celebrating the launch of Masala Mandi: A Guide to the World of Indian Spice Blends by chef, author, and storyteller Sadaf Hussain.
This special book launch goes beyond the conventional format to bring together food, history, memory, and culture through an in-depth conversation between Chef Sadaf Hussain and Chef Deepa Chauhan. Together, they will explore the layered histories and living traditions of Indian spice blends — from ancient trade routes and cultural exchanges to everyday culinary practices that continue to evolve in homes and professional kitchens alike.
Spices have always been at the heart of India’s engagement with the world, shaping not only cuisines but also economies, rituals, and identities. Through this discussion, the speakers will trace how spice blends travel across regions and generations, adapting to local palates while retaining their cultural essence. They will delve into stories of family kitchens, community festivals, seasonal rituals, and the artistry of blending spices to create distinct flavours that are simultaneously rooted and dynamic.
Drawing from his extensive culinary experiences and research, Chef Sadaf will offer insights into the making of Masala Mandi—a book that documents the diverse ways in which garam masalas, pickle masalas, chai masalas, and many other blends are crafted, reimagined, and passed down. Chef Deepa will bring to the conversation her deep engagement with Sindhi culinary heritage, her journey of rediscovering family recipes, and her contemporary culinary practice that bridges tradition and innovation.
Set in the warm and intimate space of Atta Galatta – The Bookstore, this event is designed to be a celebration of stories and aromas, a dialogue that invites food enthusiasts, culinary historians, home cooks, and curious readers to rethink their relationship with the humble masala. It is an opportunity to witness how history, heritage, and everyday kitchen practices come together to shape the unique flavourscape of India.

name: Canvas Bag Painting Workshop - A workshop by Motley Roots
description:
A Canvas Bag Painting Workshop is a creative, hands-on event where participants get to design and paint their own reusable canvas tote bags. Guided by an instructor or artist, attendees learn basic techniques in fabric painting, color mixing, brush handling, and design planning. The session usually spans 1 to 2 hours and is open to all skill levels—making it a fun, eco-friendly, and artistic experience for individuals, groups, or families.
What to Expect:
Introduction to Materials: Fabric paints, brushes, palettes, stencils, and canvas bags.
Design Guidance: Tips on creating themes—like floral, abstract, typography, or pop culture-inspired art.
Painting Techniques: Blending, outlining, layering, and fine detailing on fabric.
Drying & Finishing: How to heat-set the paint for long-lasting results.
 Why a Canvas Bag Painting Workshop is Useful
1. Promotes Sustainability
Encourages the use of reusable bags instead of plastic.
Reinforces the message of eco-conscious living in a creative format.
2. Fosters Creativity
Participants explore their artistic side, regardless of experience.
Encourages individual expression through design and color.
3. Stress Relief & Mindfulness
The hands-on painting process is calming and therapeutic.
It offers a break from digital screens and everyday stress.
4. Educational Value
Teaches basic principles of art and design.
Introduces concepts of color theory, fabric handling, and DIY techniques.
5. Team Building & Social Engagement
Perfect for corporate events, school activities, or community gatherings.
Enhances collaboration and communication in group settings.
6. Functional Art
Participants walk away with a usable, personalized item.
It’s art that has both aesthetic and practical value.
7. Ideal for All Ages
Kid-friendly and adult-friendly.
No prior experience required, making it inclusive.
Participants leave the workshop with a personalized tote bag—both functional and artistic.

name: It’s All in Your Mind - Book Reading by Trishna Patnaik
description:
Your mind is your most powerful tool—are you using it to lift yourself up or hold yourself back?
It’s All in Your Mind is the latest book release, here to help you break free from negative thought loops, build mental toughness, and create a mindset wired for growth and success.
This book is your guide to mastering your thoughts, developing emotional intelligence, and cultivating the confidence and resilience you need to move forward. If your inner voice has been holding you back, now’s the time to take control and reclaim your power.
The shift begins within. Are you ready to train your mind and transform your life?
Join us for a Book Reading Session with Trishna Patnaik, celebrated fine artist, art therapist, and wellness author, as she brings to life her latest work,“It’s All in Your Mind,” to your world.
This isn’t just a reading, it’s a journey into the world of healing, emotions, creativity, and inner transformation.
About the Author:
A self-taught artist and healer, Trishna moved on from corporate life to follow her passion for painting and wellness. With over 14 years of experience, she now helps people reconnect with themselves through art and therapy.
Reserve your spot and be part of a memorable conversation.
Tickets are Rs 250. please RSVP at the number below
RSVP: 9867982075

name: A STORY WALK through INDIRA NAGAR -
description: On a Sunday morning , Walk through the lanes of INDIRA NAGAR with Vikram Sridhar discovering the lanes through the Folklore , Heritage and Ecology of the area . The walk will begin and culminate at ATTA GALATTA . The tales will revolve around historical , mythical and personal narratives weaved as we discover the area through the walk.

name: Coffee and Conversations - Group Meetup by The Listeners Circle
description:
What about some Filter Coffee and Unfiltered conversations on a fine Sunday morning?
Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment.
We at Listeners Circle are committed to building a community where there are no unsaid words, held back emotions and buried feelings because of the fear of being judged.
After 50+ Editions of Tell your Story, Listeners Circle relaunching a lighter format - Coffee and Conversations!
Coffee lightens us up. Coffee gives us clarity. Coffee refreshes up. Sip a coffee and speak your heart out without fear of judgment and listen without judging! Coffee is on us and the onus of conversation without judgment is on you.
Every word matters. Every emotion matters. Every feeling matters.
Think about how it would feel to take an hour out of your fast-paced life and share your experiences and thoughts to people who listen to you without judging over a cup of Coffee? Also, listen to others without judging.
Listeners` circle Coffee and Conversations -This is an event to make that happen.
Be a part of the Listener`s circle Coffee & Conversations - Edition 5.
Speak your mind without being judged. Speak your mind without any boundaries. No photography and videography without consent. Your stories stay within the four walls of the room and the hearts.
Would you like to just listen? We have a place for you too.
Book your passes in advance to avoid the last-minute sell outs.
Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment. We have done 50+ sessions over the last year, enabling people to voice their stories. Coffee & Conversations is our new format based on popular demand.

name: “InVerse – LPB Special Event” - Hosted by Rajani Radhakrishnan
description:
An afternoon of immersive poetry carefully curated just for you.
This edition showcases poetry in response to the world around us with performance by three featured poets to begin the session! 
If you want to read with our three featured poets, submit your poem before (Oct 7th) on any current issue, local or global, that is impacting you. You will have 3 minutes to read your poem.
8 slots open.  Each participant will enjoy 3 minutes of reading time
Kindly submit your poem and name to letpoetrybe@gmail.com on or before 7th Oct midnight with the subject line “Inverse”.
Date: 12 October, 2025 (Sunday)
Timings: 3:00pm- 5pm
Fees: 150 INR per person inclusive of evening refreshment
Venue: Atta Galatta, Bengaluru

name: Read A Kitaab - Book Club
description:
✨Grab your coffee, your mood, and that one graphic novel you can’t stop talking about!
Join us for Read A Kitaab’s Book Club Meetup — this time, we’re diving into the world of Graphic & Comic Novels 💭💥
📍 Atta Galatta, Indira Nagar, Bangalore
🗓 12 October | Sunday | 4–6 PM
From superheroes to slice-of-life stories, let’s explore how art meets words in the most vivid way. Don’t miss out on this cozy, creative evening! 🌈📚

name: “An Evening of Magic” - Magic Show by Nakul Shenoy and Friends
description: An Evening of Magic is a most amazing magic show presented by `Nakul Shenoy & Friends’, featuring top entertainers and magic acts. Curated and hosted by the internationally-acclaimed mentalist Nakul Shenoy, each event in this series brings unique acts and performances by nationally and internationally acclaimed magicians, alongside some of the most notable up-and-coming stars of magic. This is an evening that is truly magical, and one you will want to experience many times over.

name: “The Wildflower of Assam” - Book Discussion by Gayatri Sarkar
description:
Join us for an engaging evening at Atta Galatta, Bangalore’s iconic bookstore and cultural space, as Gayatri Sarkar discusses her acclaimed debut novel The Wildflower of Assam.
Set against the turbulent backdrop of Assam between the 1950s and 1980s, this historical and women’s fiction novel traces the lives of migrant women navigating displacement, resilience, and identity. Through the unforgettable character of Shabana and her family, the story weaves together themes of survival, migration, and the search for belonging.
In conversation with Sweety Roy, Gayatri will share insights into her research, writing journey, and the social realities that shaped the novel. The discussion will be followed by an audience Q&A and a book signing session.
 
Why attend?

Discover the inspiration and untold history behind The Wildflower of Assam
Be part of an intimate conversation on migration, women’s voices, and resilience
Connect with the author and get your copy signed

name: Familiar Strangers - A workshop by Saachi & Pragya
description:
Every day we encounter countless people, some friends, some strangers. Among the friends and strangers, there are familiar strangers: the people who appear regularly in our daily paths yet remain largely unseen.
This student-led workshop is built around using fiction to better understand these familiar strangers through noticing, mapping, and reimagining. Come sit, chat, and build new characters with us.

name: Vrindaban, Present Please  - An Interactive play written and performed by Somudranil Sarkar
description:
About the play "Vrindaban, Present Please" is an immersive, one-man interactive play set in a rural Indian village, where Samiran Banerjee, a Kolkata teacher, is transferred to a village school after a Supreme Court ruling. Assigned to a chaotic school once led by the mysteriously absent Salma Khatoon, Samiran's efforts to restore order only lead him deeper into unsettling events. From a water shortage to a snake in his room, his attempts to connect with the eccentric villagers only intensify his isolation. But behind it all, Samiran harbors a secret—someone named Vrindaban. Why does he hide this figure? Is it the only refuge in a world that refuses to understand him? The play unravels questions about isolation, hidden truths, and the blurred lines between personal and professional life.
About the artist:  Somudranil Sarkar, a theatre maker from kolkata. He has over 25 years of experience in theatre and has had the privilege of training under some of the most respected names in the Bengali theatre circuit, including Rudraprasad Sengupta, Swatilekha Sengupta, Debshankar Halder, Sohini Sengupta, and Goutam Halder in Nandikar. He has also trained in mime under the guidance of mime guru Jogesh Dutta. Over the years, he has directed and acted in over 100 plays and curated various theatre workshops for diverse groups. Somudranil has received the Azhar Alam Young Director’s Award for his contribution to the field.

name: Making My Storybook - Workshop for Children by Shloka K.
description:
Colors for the characters, words for the story, plain white pages to be filled with your child’s creativity.
“Making My Storybook” is a hands-on book-making workshop for parents and their 3-5 year olds. This isn’t just doodles and colors, it’s a peek into your child’s world. A world shaped by everyday observations and experiences. This workshop opens up space for open-ended conversations with your child that may reveal cues about their interests, thoughts, and needs.
So, join us for an hour filled with colors, conversation, and creativity - and walk away with a storybook that’s uniquely yours.
Takeaways from this workshop:
- A storybook illustrated and authored by your child
- An hour of conversational creativity
- Insight into your child’s current interests and needs
- Moments of bonding and joy with your child

name: Food In Literature - Monthly Book Club
description:
Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well. So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us for a dialogue on “Food in Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we read our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives. 
October Read: Desi Delicacies. 
Edited by Claire Chambers
We assure you that you will enjoy every single bite! The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available. Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who to love to read and eat!
Copies of the book are available at the store.

name: Hand Embroidery Workshop - Workshop by Swikruti Pradhan
description:
About the Workshop
Unwind from your busy schedules and join me for an enchanting Hand Embroidery Workshop. Hand embroidery is more than just a craft – it’s an experience.
Why attend?
Learn a Mindful, Timeless Skill
Embroidery slows you down in the best way possible. It’s a meditative, hands-on way to unwind from busy schedules.
Connect with Creativity & Community
You’ll meet others who share a love for handmade art and be inspired by the group's collective energy.
Take Home Something You Made
At the end of the session, you’ll have a small, hand-embroidered piece – a keepsake of your effort and creativity.
Date: October 25, 2025, Saturday 
Time: 4 to 6 PM
Age: 15+
Fees: INR 1,200/- 
This workshop includes all the materials.
Each participant gets a cotton tote bag to embroider, which they will take back home.

name: Unmask the Art: Cherial Mask Making Workshop - Celebrate Traditional Indian Craftmanship
description:
Immerse yourself in the vibrant world of Cherial masks, renowned for intricate designs and storytelling. Join our workshop to explore the history, significance, and craftsmanship of these iconic masks.
Cherial masks are a traditional Indian art form originating from Cheriyal village in Telangana's Warangal district. These vibrant masks are a modified version of Nakashi art and are known for their intricate designs and storytelling.
Ticket price also includes art material

name: Atta Galatta presents “Support Group” - Support Group by Nimesh George and Gokul R.
description:
People make up big cities but what makes up people’s lives, hopefully not loneliness. Loneliness is an intensely painful state which arises out of lack of intimacy and connectedness. People from every walk of life, even those with social contacts or pursuing successful careers can experience sadness from absence of belongingness. This painful experience is felt in a myriad of contexts such as breakups, disagreeing families, fear of rejection, unrelatability, shyness and so on.
This support group has been constituted to bring people struggling with disconnectedness in various contexts together for a shared experience of comfort, belongingness, laughter, guidance and above all to break the cycle of sustained loneliness.
The support is being organized and moderated by Nimesh George Mphil PhD who is a practicing psychologist based in Bangalore. This session will be co-moderated by Nimesh George & Gokul R, who are both practising psychologists in Bangalore.

name: Bhang and Beyond - Book Signing by Akshaya Bahibala
description:
We’re delighted to host an engaging session with Akshaya Bahibala, author of Bhang Journeys, a book that is part cultural history, part social commentary, and is also shaped by his own tryst with bhang. 
Join us for an open and interactive conversation where you can chat with him, hear about his journey, and of course, get your copies signed

name: ONCE UPON A BRUNCH - Sunday morning brunch and stories by Vikram Sridhar
description:
Late weekend morning , brunch , stories like the ones from the olden times, meeting new people.
What if they all come together?
Weekend and late morning Brunch is an emotion . On the other hand, stories have always been an emotion too . What's common between the two is the rich heritage of food and stories. What if they come together?
Listen to these stories of the food as you enjoy your weekend Brunch set at a cozy location that has its own stories . A beautiful day starts with a lovely breakfast . And a morning with breakfast and stories . Every food we eat has a story to share .. Idli , Vada , bread , Paratha etc. Every breakfast comes after a long break and is eager to be eaten. A simple Weekend morning Brunch put together by Atta Galatta
Storytelling around the food lores by Vikram Sridhar

name: Tara Goes Aahhhhh! - Book Reading by Garima Gupta
description:
Facing Fears with Roars and Giggles! Ready for a story that doesn’t need words—just your eyes, your imagination, and all those big, bold feelings? Join Tara and her dino buddy on a wild, wordless adventure as they tackle their fears in the pop-up book Tara Goes Aahhhhh! with author Garima Gupta. It's a roar-some ride through emotions, courage, and friendship.
Age: 4-8, accompanied by a parent.
